titleStmt.title: L.T. Savacool v. Territory of Washington. Plaintiff's Petition

bibl.title: L.T. Savacool. Plaintiff's Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In District Court of Columbia County Washington territory, holding terms at Dayton.
Before Hon. William G. Lang- ford Judge of above named Court
In the matter of the application of L. T. Savacool for Writ of Habeas Corpus
by the Hon William G. Lang- ford Judge of the above named Court and associate Justice of the Subpoena Court of the Territory of Washington
The petition of L. T. Savacool the plaintiff respectfully shows:

1 That he is illegally imprisoned, detained confined and restrained of this liberty by J. H. Hosler, Sheriff of Columbia County Washington Territory; he is confined by said Sheriff in the county jail at the City of Dayton in the county and territory aforesaid.

2nd That the cause or precurse of such restrain according to the best of his knowledge and belief of the applicant is this; this applicant was brought before William Newland one of the Justices of the Peace in and for Garfield County, Washington Territory, for examination upon a charge of uttering and publishing action a deed for property and upon examination by said Justice of the Peace on this said applicant be held to answer said charge before the grand jury of Garfield County, And the said Sheriff J.H. Hosler claims and shall keep, imprison and restrain applicant of this liberty - by writing a commitment issued by said Justice of the Peace authorizing him into his custody and safely keep said applicant.

3rd This restrain is illegal in this, the said instrument of which this appli- cant is charged with of having uttered and published action, a deed for property - or any one of the instruments mentioned in section 854 of the Code of Washington.

That said Sheriff J.H. Hosler has on writ and Committment issued by said Justice of the Peace and all authorizing or empowering him the said Sheriff imprison, detain or restrain said applicant of his liberty - or as all
Wherefor he for a writ of Habeas Corpus that the same may be inquired and he be discharged
Territory of Washington County of Columbia } SS
L.T. Savacool being first duly sworn say he is petitioner and applicant above named this the foregoing petition or complaint is true as he verily believes.
subscribed and sworn to before me this 18 day of February 1884
